channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [LOG4J2-3579] log4j2 2.18.0 ServiceLoaderUtil broken with SecurityManager enabled
item.description:
The new ServiceLoaderUtil causes a Java Security Manager regression in WildFly. The current version 2.17.2 works fine in integration tests, 2.18.0 breaks

See https://github.com/wildfly/wildfly-core/pull/5187

java.lang.AssertionError: Failed to deploy logging1.jar: 10 assets: {"WFLYCTL0080: Failed services" => {"jboss.deployment.unit.\"logging1.jar\".INSTALL" => "WFLYSRV0153: Failed to process phase INSTALL of deployment \"logging1.jar\"
    Caused by: java.util.ServiceConfigurationError: org.jboss.msc.service.ServiceActivator: Provider org.jboss.as.test.integration.logging.Log4j2ServiceActivator could not be instantiated
    Caused by: java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
    Caused by: java.security.AccessControlException: WFSM000001: Permission check failed (permission \"(\"java.io.FilePermission\" \"/store/repository/org/apache/logging/log4j/log4j-api/2.18.0/log4j-api-2.18.0.jar\" \"read\")\" in code source \"(vfs:/content/logging1.jar <no signer certificates>)\" of \"ModuleClassLoader for Module \"deployment.logging1.jar\" from Service Module Loader\")"}}

item.summary: log4j2 2.18.0 ServiceLoaderUtil broken with SecurityManager enabled

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
xf01213,

How can I enable the SecurityManager in the WildFly test suite? Using the default setup from Github, I can not reproduce your test case failure.

Good Morning pkarwasz

thanks for your fast reply. Sorry for the missing steps to reproduce:

  1. setup Java11(path + JAVA_HOME) and Maven3.8
  2. git clone https://github.com/wildfly/wildfly-core.git
  3. bump Apache log4j2 version to 2.18.0 (or your testing SNAPSHOT version) https://github.com/wildfly/wildfly-core/blob/main/pom.xml#L218
  4. mvn clean install -Dsecurity.manager -Dmaven.test.failure.ignore=true -DfailIfNoTests=false -Dtest=org.jboss.as.test.integration.logging.profiles.Log4j2LoggingProfilesTestCase

There are more logging tests failing, a full run can be done with:
mvn clean install -DallTests -Dsecurity.manager -Dmaven.test.failure.ignore=true

There is no 27.x updated version yet, but https://docs.wildfly.org/26.1/Testsuite.html and https://docs.wildfly.org/26.1/Hacking_On_WildFly.html can help.

If you want we can meet in a web chat tool of your choice.

Commit 880acdfdb0b3c13c73c9ab3375924e238814f948 in logging-log4j2's branch refs/heads/release-2.x from Piotr P. Karwasz
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=logging-log4j2.git;h=880acdfdb0 ]

LOG4J2-3579 Calls ServiceLoader with caller's security context

When running with a security manager, `ServiceLoaderUtil` will call
`ServiceLoader` with the privileges of the caller.

Commit 8bd34d946c5f7c590320981bb32e18260fb9ed85 in logging-log4j2's branch refs/heads/release-2.x from Piotr P. Karwasz
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=logging-log4j2.git;h=8bd34d946c ]

LOG4J2-3579

xf01213,

I submitted the solution to the release-2.x branch, so you should find it in the 2.18.1-SNAPSHOT (the snapshots are on https://repository.apache.org/snapshots). Can you recheck if it works and close the issue?

Commit a3a3dab606b00a0ae1e3d9e5f5e179155936a13c in logging-log4j2's branch refs/heads/master from Piotr P. Karwasz
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=logging-log4j2.git;h=a3a3dab606 ]

LOG4J2-3579 Calls ServiceLoader with caller's security context

When running with a security manager, `ServiceLoaderUtil` will call
`ServiceLoader` with the privileges of the caller.

The conflict was resolved by merging the version from `log4j-api-java9`
to `log4j-api`.
